title: [Bug] Package Built but not in Database
body:
@davydden @adamjstewart @tgamblin 

I did `spack install modele`.  This failed on `modele`.  I immediately repeated `spack install modele`, which produced the following error on `everytrace`, one of `modele`'s dependencies:

```
==> everytrace is already installed in /home2/rpfische/spack2/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/everytrace-develop-6jjehjenba2xqm6v6s37erahxzjxrblr
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "bin/spack", line 184, in <module>
    main()
  File "bin/spack", line 161, in main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/home2/rpfische/spack2/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 92, in install
    explicit=True)
  File "/home2/rpfische/spack2/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 909, in do_install
    run_tests=run_tests)
  File "/home2/rpfische/spack2/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1059, in do_install_dependencies
    dep.package.do_install(**kwargs)
  File "/home2/rpfische/spack2/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 891, in do_install
    rec = spack.installed_db.get_record(self.spec)
  File "/home2/rpfische/spack2/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 76, in converter
    return function(self, spec_like, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home2/rpfische/spack2/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 468, in get_record
    key = self._get_matching_spec_key(spec, **kwargs)
  File "/home2/rpfische/spack2/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 463, in _get_matching_spec_key
    raise KeyError("No such spec in database! %s" % spec)
KeyError: 'No such spec in database! everytrace@develop%gcc@4.9.3+fortran+mpi arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^cmake@3.6.0%gcc@4.9.3~doc+ncurses+openssl~qt arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^hwloc@1.11.3%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^libpciaccess@0.13.4%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^libsigsegv@2.10%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^m4@1.4.17%gcc@4.9.3+sigsegv arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^ncurses@6.0%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^openmpi@2.0.0%gcc@4.9.3~mxm~pmi~psm~psm2~slurm~sqlite3~thread_multiple~tm~verbs+vt arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^openssl@system%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64'
```

My guess is this is related to #1561, that something somewhere is handling `develop` versions in a way that breaks this code.  Any pointers to what might be going wrong?
